skillsDefinition.content:
# Basic data structures

The ability to recognize the need to use and to use Arrays and Objects in a
properly way.

# Basic form creation

The ability to develop basic forms that collects user data, like names, numbers
and text.

# Cloud based authentication firebase auth

The ability to authenticate and register users in a webapp using a cloud based system like Firebas auth.

# Cloud based persistance Firebase

The ability to persist data using Firebase tools.

# Collaborative version control system

The ability to use a version control system to work in groups.

# CRUD functions

The ability to understand and apply the four basic functions of persistent storage.

# Data-driven interfaces

The ability to use understand and develop an interface that is a function of
data.

# Functional programming fundamentals

The ability to understand and explain functional programming fundamentals like
`pure functions` and `side-effects`.

# Graphic user interface (GUI)

This is the ability to understand and to develop a graphic user interface
which with the user can interact.

# Interface library: React

The ability to use the React interface library effectively to create a complete web application.

# JavaScript asynchrony

The ability to understand and use JavaScript's event loop

# Mathematical problem solving

The ability to resolve mathematical operations using JavaScript.

# Module authorship

The ability to author a module in a standard way.

# NodeJS-introduction

The ability to understand the basic concepts of NodeJS.

# Offline first

The ability to design and build a web application that can be used without Internet connection.

# Entender los fundamentos de programación.

The ability to give instructions to a computer in a procedural way.

# Recursion-understanding

The ability to understand the idea of recursion and how to apply it in real-world examples.

# Diseño web responsivo.

The ability to adapt a website to a given layout without breaking the user
experience.

# Router library: React router

The ability to use the React router library effectively to create a complete navigation experience in React web application.

# Single page application

The ability to show views based on URL changes made through the History API.

# Task scheduling

The ability to pospone actions (functions) to be executed in the future and the
ability to schedule recurrent tasks at certain intervals.

# Terminal interaction

The ability to be proficient in the use of a Terminal.

# Test driven development introduction (Awareness)

The ability to think of requirements first and to write tests that validate
those requirements before writing any functionality.
Use of unit tests to write down requirements.

# User interface layout

The ability to develop a fluid layout that could be indicated by a design file.

# Version control system

The ability to use a version control system to manage updates and diff to one's
own work.

# Web application deployment

The ability to host a web application.
